sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. In this figure we have \(BC \parallel AF \), and \(BD \parallel AG \). Now, prove that \(CD \parallel FG \).
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
In the triangle EFA , we have $BC \parallel AF $. So, we can write that
\[
	\frac{EC }{CF } = \frac{EB }{BA }
\]
Now, again in triangle EGA , we have $BD \parallel AG $. So, we can write
\[
	\frac{EB }{BA } = \frac{ED }{DG }
\]
From the above two equations, we get
\[
	\frac{EC }{CF } = \frac{ED }{DG }
\]
Thus, in the triangle EFG we can write 
\[
	\frac{EC }{CF } = \frac{ED }{DG }
\]
Which means $CD \parallel FG $. Hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
